nodes.bodyText:
this should be a boolean value, why is it not a boolean?
also name should be changed to isDefault

how do you enforce that there is only one default location in place?
is there something that prevents a default location from being added?
Default location is created only for open studies . Location will added into the system only through participant manager.
okay, then do you need to create a locationBO for all studies, as you are doing here?
Default location will be only once and its pre populated into the same while executing user reg server's database script.  Here we are only adding data into app_info, org_info and sites table.
this should be set at the database level as the column default.
will be handled during data integrity changes .
let's fix it here while the context is fresh.
ping on this?
These changes already integrated through PR #713
I am not seeing these fixed in the follow up PR, please fix here.
Added the fixes to this PR now along with test case modification to accommodate the data integrity checks
shouldn't this set to a readable value? if status is an enum (which I would recommend) then in the code you should refer to the status.value, and not put in the value directly.

we already planned to introduce enum as part of code refactoring activity during area of improvement implementation. TO keep a track of this change if you are okay we can create a ticket and close this PR.
let's fix here, it probably takes less time to fix while you familiar with the code and context.
These changes already integrated through PR #713 . Hence request you to please approve this PR
I don't see this file in PR #713 at all. Please fix here.
Added the fixes to this PR now along with test case modification to accommodate the data integrity checks
this looks like it should be a foreign key and not set to zero by default.
This zero default values added only for open studies. However in the actual implementation correct foreign key value will added by participant manager.
what do you mean actual implementation, I don't think this is a test file.
I meant Participant Manager. The reason we set zero here was , when a study published in study builder and pushed the studymeta data into user reg server we do not have the created by information.

where does this value get updated to its actual value?
To give you more context, each field should be populated with only correct data, And no dummy values should exist in the code.
If you are not able to gather the correct information because a certain part of the code is not ready, then the column should be removed until the code becomes ready.
Adding these columns in advance and filling them with dummy values, could lead to us accidentally releasing a software that creates and stores fake data, and I would like to prevent that when possible.

Actual value will be participant manager logged in user's user id.
For Open study we need to create a default site each time a new open study published in study builder application  . Could you please let us know in this scenario what value we need to set for created by column to differentiate site creation .

If a value can be empty, it should be left as NULL.
Having a 0 value would prevent us from enforcing a foreign Key connection when needed.
this is not addressed
fixed now

from what I can see this code creates and stores a default site associated with default location and store it within session, regardless of the type of study.
Why is it needed for token based studies?

Initial logic is to added default site each open study. However as the participant manager is still in the development phase  as a work around we have provided a database script to add the tokens and mapped to individual participants directly into the database object , we do not have any UI in place to add sites into the system. Hence these logic is added for default site for token based study as well.

I don't see why that would mean any code change.
If you have a script to inject the values while the participant manager is in process then there is no need to alter the code, correct?

To make enroll into study, a participant needs to map to a site . When we are injecting participants through script for token based enrollment, site details is required or else enroll flow will break.
please remove additional spacing between imports. Please refer to the styleguide for formatting of imports.
Fixed the format issue
